creditline: Gift of Tamara and Michael Root
medium: Stoneware with iron and cobalt slip/oxides, sgraffito and glazes
text: Voulkos brought Asian and Abstract Expressionist qualities to his functional pottery before moving fully into non-functional sculpture. This low bowl displays Voulkos’s control on the wheel while the broad, Japanese-inspired brushstrokes depicting figures show the influence of Bernard Leach and Shoji Hamada. The pair made a stop at the Archie Bray Foundation, in Montana, while Voulkos was a resident potter there in 1952—a tour arranged by Warren and Alix MacKenzie (they visited St. Paul along the way).
title: Low bowl or plate
